activities.loc: Courtroom E, Fourth Floor - South Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tania S Reierson

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 12, 2023 at 10:45 am.

2:59 PM Defendant Tania S Reierson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender Office. Court appoints attorney Katharine Cullen, court to set up a payment at next hearing.  Scheduling order to be sent out.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:06 AM Defendant Tania S Reierson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Anne Theresa Nack appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court enters not guilty plea on Defendants behalf. Matter to be set.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim S.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May have one time visit with police escort to collect immediately necessary personal items.

2:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tania S Reierson appeared by phone. Warrant vacated. Defendant address verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond set of $150 with conditions. No contact directly or indirectly with victim S.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May have one time visit with police escort to collect immediately necessary personal items. Defendant must sign bond by August 12, 2022. Defendant does not wish to have interpreter.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Activity:  Failed to appear at initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:59 PM  Intern Verity Altenberger by video supervised by Noah Tylenda by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tania S Reierson not in court. Court orders warrant on non-appearance.  Cash bond of $100 set.
Initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
